p: Compounds 37 to 43 were derived from leaves of Senecio roseiflorus and have shown good to moderate antiplasmodial activities against D6 and W2 strains. The activities in terms of IC 50 values ranged from 11.25 to 56.31 µM for the D6 strain, while for the W2 strain, this ranged from 15.47 to 87.50 µM [ 76]. Compounds 44 to 46, were derived from roots of Tephrosia villosa and exhibited anti-malarial activities against both the D6 and W2 strains with respective IC 50 values from 11.30 to 14.00 µM for the D6 strain and from 13.10 to 20.40 µM for the W2 strain [ 77].
